feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Prevent empty version columns in table for version‐restricted measure
entry.content:
I have a story based on an Account-based model that uses multiple versions (A0, A1, A2, B0, B1, C0, D0, E10, E20, E30). In the underlying model, I’ve created calculated measures that are restricted to specific versions—for example, a measure that only applies to version D0.

Problem:
Even though the measure is correctly defined to return values only for version D0, when I add it to a table in my story, SAC still creates separate columns for every version (A0–E30), leaving most columns empty. This results in a large number of unnecessary blank columns.

Question:
Is there a way to prevent SAC from generating empty columns for versions where the restricted measure has no data? In other words, can I force the table to show the measure only under its defined version (D0) and omit all other version columns entirely?

entry.title: How to properly connect SAC to PaPM On-Prem with the PaPM API and use SSO
entry.content:
Dear experts:

I have a requirement to connect SAC to an On Premise PaPM instance using the PaPM API and it must use SSO as part of the connection. 

Suffice it to say, Paul Simon knows 50 ways to leave your lover, and I have found 50 so-called solutions to my problem, but none of them work. 

Has anyone been able to do what my requirement is asking for? Again, the PaPM instance is on premise and the user wants to use multiple functions in SAC for PaPM. We can get it to work with a static user and password, but even with all the setup work completed as per several blogs, the connection will not work.

entry.title: Guidance for Adjusting Drill Limits in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for end users
entry.content:
Hi Community,

In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), when a table exceeds the default drill limit of 500 rows or 60 columns, a warning symbol (⚠️) appears. While I understand that users can manually adjust the drill limit by hovering over the warning and selecting “Edit Drill Limitation”, I’m looking for the best way to guide end users through this process effectively.

Specifically, I’d like to know:

  • Is there a recommended way to display a message or popup within the story or analytic application to instruct users on how to change the drill limit? need steps how to do this?
  • Can this be automated or triggered when the warning appears?
  • Are there any best practices or UI/UX suggestions for making this guidance more intuitive for business users?

Any insights, examples, or documentation links would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
Govardhana Rao Vegi

entry.title: How to create a measure in SAC that always shows a fixed month value regardless of the data filter
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud with an import model based on an Excel file.

I need to create a calculated measure that should always display the value of another measure restricted to a specific month (e.g., January), but it should remain visible across all months in the story, even if a date filter is applied.

Example:

  • I have a measure [Legacy Book Value Assets].

  • I want to create another measure that takes only the value of [Legacy Book Value Assets] for January 2025.

  • When I filter the story for June 2025, I still want this "January-based" measure to be displayed for every month (replicated), instead of disappearing because of the date filter.

I tried using a Restricted Measure for January, but when I change the date filter in the story, the measure goes blank.

Is there a way to define this logic directly in the model (calculated measure), so that the value for January remains visible across all months, regardless of the story filters?

Any workaround, formula example, model design best practice would be highly appreciated but please do not consider Data Action solutions.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to Perform 80/20 Spend Analysis on Suppliers in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I'm looking to perform a Pareto analysis in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to identify how many suppliers account for 80% of our total spend. I understand this involves using the 80/20 rule, and I’d appreciate guidance or best practices on how to implement this effectively in SAC.

 

Best Regards,

Govardhan

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud How to Aggregate a Calculated Measure to the User-Selected Date
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need to create a calculated measure "TEST" in SAP Analytics Cloud that sums a measure from the beginning of the year up to the date selected by the user in the story. 

The base measure I am using  [Program_Gross_Investment_Income] is itself a calculated measure .

What I tried

  1. YTD Function
    YTD([Program_Gross_Investment_Income], [d/Date])
    → Returns no values, seems not to work with calculated measures:

     

  2. LOOKUP Function
    LOOKUP([Program_Gross_Investment_Income], [d/Date] = ToPeriod("Month"))
    → Fails with an error; LOOKUP appears unsuitable for cumulative logic.

     

  3. ITERATE Function
    ITERATE(PRIOR() + [Program_Gross_Investment_Income], [Program_Gross_Investment_Income], [d/Date].[p/DAY])
    → Works fine but only when multiple months are selected. If only one month is filtered, it ignores previous months: 

What I need

  • Aggregate a calculated measure YTD which sums all the months before the selected one, regardless of the filter.

  • Ensure previous months are included even if only one month is selected.

Has anyone found a working approach or best practice for this? I would appriciate any suggestions or workarounds.

Many thanks in advance!

entry.title: Delete data from previous months after adding those to the targetmonth
entry.content:
Hello team,

I have a data action with the following code:

MEMBERSET [d/Date] = %SourceMonth% TO %TargetMonth%

MEMBERSET [d/CP_DI_Origem] = ("Compromissos")

DATA([d/Date] = %TargetMonth%) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(11, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(10, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(9, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(8, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(7, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(6, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(5, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(4, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(3, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(2, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1, "MONTH", %TargetMonth%)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = %TargetMonth%)

After calculating the sum for the target month, I want it to clear the values from the previous months.
Is there a way to do this in a single data action?

I tried using parameters, but I need to select multiple months from SourceMonth up to TargetMonth - 1. However, when using parameters, I'm only allowed to set granularity to single and cardinality to Leaf.

Can you help me with this?

Thank you very much,
Ganjos

entry.title: Can we delete unused master data from dimension in SAC via data action
entry.content:
Can we delete unused master data from dimension in SAC via data action, if we don't have related transactional data in the model?

I am loading master data from S4 hana and let's say one record is not present in source anymore. But we have already imported that record in our SAC dimension previously. Now I don't have any transactional data available for that dimension. How can I ensure that , the ID of that record should not be present in my dimension.

SAP Analytics Cloud SAP Analytics Cloud for planning

entry.title: How to calculate depreciation for multiple capitalizations across years in SAC?
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm working on a CAPEX planning model in SAP Analytics Cloud, and doing depreciation logic where multiple capitalizations happen in different years, each with their own timeline, but they all sum up into the fixed asset value and depreciate based on their own start date.

I don’t have a dedicated "capitalization year" field, only the date dimension (e.g., FY, period). I’m looking to:

  1. Accumulate the Fixed Asset value based on the total capitalized until that year.

  2. Calculate depreciation per year for each capitalized amount based on the useful life (e.g., straight-line method).

  3. Ensure that the depreciation logic respects the start year of each capitalized amount and stops after its life ends.

 Below is the code I am having and results attached in screenshot. Thanks

FOREACH.BOOKED [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT]
 
//get the total budget
@TOTALBUDGET = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount", [d/Account] = "CAPEX_003", [d/Date] = PERIOD([d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/BUDGETEDYEAR]))
//get the previous year spending
@PYSPENDING = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount", [d/Account] = "CAPEX_012", [d/Date] = "2022")
//calculate remaining budget
@REMAININGBUDGET = ROUND(@TOTALBUDGET - @PYSPENDING, 3)
//calculate the annual depreciation
@ANNUALDEPR = ROUND(@REMAININGBUDGET / @USEFULLIFE, 2)
@ENERGIZEDYEAR = ATTRIBUTE([d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/ENERGIZEDYEAR])
@YEAR_COUNT = 0
@count = INT(@USEFULLIFE)
 
FOREACH [d/Date]
//get the energized year
//DATA([d/Account] = #ENERGYEAR_VAL, [d/DIM_AUDIT] = "#", [d/DIM_BUDGETYEAR] = "#", [d/DIM_FLOW] = "#", [d/DIM_SCENARIO] = "#", [d/Measures] = "Amount") = ATTRIBUTE([d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/ENERGIZEDYEAR])
// Read year of this Date member
@Number = @ENERGIZEDYEAR - @BUDEGTYEAR + 1
@CURRYEAR = YEAR([d/Date])
IF @CURRYEAR <= @ENERGIZEDYEAR AND @REMAININGBUDGET > 0 THEN
//BOOK the annual spending
DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_001") = ROUND(@REMAININGBUDGET / @Number, 6)
//BOOK CWIP
DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_012") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_012",[d/Date]=PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_001")
//Fixed Assets
DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007",[d/Date]=PREVIOUS(1))+RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
//CWIP Final
DATA( [d/Account] = "CAPEX_013") = RESULTLOOKUP( [d/Account] = "CAPEX_013",[d/Date]=PREVIOUS(1))+ RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_001")-RESULTLOOKUP( [d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
ENDIF
@CAPITALIZED = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
FOR @start_COUNT = 1 TO @count
DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004",[d/Date] = NEXT(@START_COUNT)) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007") /@USEFULLIFE
ENDFOR

entry.title: How to Automate Multi Action Execution via REST API (Server-Side) without User Interaction?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a question regarding the automation of processes using the SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) REST API.

What I want to achieve:

I am trying to call the SAC REST API from a server-side application (e.g., Python, Node.js) to execute a specific Multi Action in a fully automated manner. The target API endpoint is: /api/v1/multiActions/{multiActionId}/execute

Current Situation and Challenges:

To handle authentication for the API call, I have created an OAuth 2.0 client from the SAC administration menu (System > Administration).

My first attempt was to create a client with the "Interactive Usage" purpose. However, based on the documentation, I understand that this purpose requires a redirect URI for user authentication and consent. This approach seems designed for scenarios where a web application acts on behalf of a user.

This has led to the following challenge:

Because user interaction (logging in and clicking the consent screen in a browser) is required, it is difficult to create a completely automated, server-to-server batch process.

My Questions:

  • Is there a recommended solution for calling the Multi Action execution API from a server-side application as a batch process, without any user interaction?
  • I also tried creating an OAuth client with the "API Access" purpose, but I could not get it to work. If this is the correct approach, could you please provide guidance on the proper configuration or point out potential reasons for failure (e.g., missing permissions)?
  • Alternatively, is there a fundamental misunderstanding in my approach to automating SAC API calls?

I have managed to successfully obtain an OAuth token using the "API Access" purpose. However, when I use this token to call the API in my execute_multi_action method, the request fails with a 500 Internal Server Error.

Here is the sample Python code that demonstrates the issue. The get_oauth_token and get_csrf_token function works correctly, but the execute_multi_action function receives the 500 error.

import requests
import json

# Constants for authentication and API endpoints (masked for security)
TOKEN_URL = "https://<MASKED>.authentication.<MASKED>.ondemand.com/oauth/token"
SAC_BASE = "https://<MASKED>.analytics.cloud.sap"
CLIENT_ID = '<MASKED_CLIENT_ID>'
CLIENT_SECRET = '<MASKED_CLIENT_SECRET>'
MULTI_ACTION_ID = '<MASKED_MULTI_ACTION_ID>'

def get_bearer_token():
    """
    Obtain OAuth2 bearer token using client credentials grant.
    """
    resp = requests.post(
        TOKEN_URL,
        auth=(CLIENT_ID, CLIENT_SECRET),
        data={'grant_type': 'client_credentials'}
    )
    resp.raise_for_status()  # Raise an error for HTTP error codes
    return resp.json()['access_token']

def get_csrf_token(session, bearer_token):
    """
    Retrieve CSRF token required for subsequent API requests.
    """
    url = f"{SAC_BASE}/api/v1/csrf"
    headers = {
        'x-csrf-token': 'fetch',                # Request to fetch CSRF token
        'x-sap-sac-custom-auth': 'true',
        'Authorization': f"Bearer {bearer_token}",
    }
    # Send GET request to retrieve CSRF token
    resp = session.get(url, headers=headers)
    resp.raise_for_status()
    csrf_token = resp.headers.get('x-csrf-token')
    print(f"CSRF Token: {csrf_token}")
    return csrf_token

def execute_multi_action(session, bearer_token, csrf_token):
    """
    Execute a multi-action via SAC API with required parameters.
    """
    url = f"{SAC_BASE}/api/v1/multiActions/{MULTI_ACTION_ID}/executions"
    headers = {
        'x-csrf-token': csrf_token,
        'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        'x-sap-sac-custom-auth': 'true',
        'Authorization': f"Bearer {bearer_token}",
    }
    payload = {
        "parameterValues": [
            {
                "parameterId": "TargetVersion",
                "value": {
                    "memberIds": ["public.Plan_TEST"],
                    "hierarchyId": None
                }
            },
            {
                "parameterId": "SourceVersion",
                "value": {
                    "memberIds": ["public.Actual"],
                    "hierarchyId": None
                }
            }
        ]
    }
    # Send POST request to execute the multi-action
    resp = session.post(url, headers=headers, data=json.dumps(payload))
    resp.raise_for_status()
    return resp.json()["executionId"]

def get_execution_result(session, execution_id):
    """
    Retrieve the result or status of the executed multi-action.
    """
    url = f"{SAC_BASE}/api/v1/multiActions/{MULTI_ACTION_ID}/executions/{execution_id}"
    # Send GET request to get execution result
    resp = session.get(url)
    resp.raise_for_status()
    return resp.json()

def main():
    # Step 1: Obtain bearer token for authentication
    bearer_token = get_bearer_token()
    with requests.Session() as session:
        # Step 2: Get CSRF token for secure API requests
        csrf_token = get_csrf_token(session, bearer_token)
        print("Current cookies in session:")
        for cookie in session.cookies:
            print(f"{cookie.name} = {cookie.value}")

        # Prepare cookie string for use in headers (if needed)
        cookie_string = "; ".join([f"{c.name}={c.value}" for c in session.cookies])
        print("Cookie string for headers:")
        print(cookie_string)

        # Step 3: Execute the multi-action and get its execution ID
        execution_id = execute_multi_action(session, bearer_token, csrf_token)
        # Step 4: Retrieve and print the execution result
        result = get_execution_result(session, execution_id)
        print(json.dumps(result, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Thank you for your time and assistance.

Best regards,

entry.title: How to order in a SAC chart without displaying the ordering dimension itself?
entry.content:
hi,

we use a SAC datashere model. for aa story in SAC cloud.

I have to order the chart from the current posting period descending.

for this we create a extra dimension (PP_Sorted) in DSP for teh correct order:

The dimension "PP_Sorted"  (1) i use to order the chart, but i want to display only the "Posting period" (2)  in the chart. (see screenshot below)

is it possible or other ideas?

e.g. August - February

posting period     PP_Sorted 

  •  005     1
  • 004       2
  • 003       3
  • 002       4
  • 001       5
  • 012       6
  • 011       7

     

    

 best regards

Oliver

entry.title: Dynamic Text box
entry.content:
Hello team!


We need to add a dynamic text box to the story, with the goal of displaying only the year based on the date from the table in the story. However, our Date dimension does not allow us to select only the Year.
